fields.value: ABC News Timothy McVeigh Verdict Poll, June 1997

dsDescriptionValue.value: This special topic poll, conducted on June 2, 1997--the day   that a jury convicted Timothy McVeigh of planning and planting the   bomb that killed 168 people in Oklahoma City in 1995--sought   respondents' views on the verdict and on terrorist attacks in the   United States. Respondents were asked whether they agreed with the   verdict, whether McVeigh should receive the death penalty, and   whether they believed that the government had caught everyone   responsible. A series of questions addressed concern over terrorist   attacks in the United States, including whether the respondent   believed that he/she or anyone they knew was a potential victim of  terrorism. Background information on respondents includes sex.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIV.C.1. Mass Political Behavior and Attitudes, Public Opinion on Political Matters, United States
TPDRC II. Terrorism and Preparedness Survey Archive (TaPSA)
